content:
Cool puzzle. As someone who has played a bit of osu! this was pretty straight forward and fun, but I can understand for others it would be overwhelming and arbitrarily complex.
While attempting this puzzle out, I had the combo initialized to 1, "By default, the Combo Multiplier is equal to 1.", but I couldn't get the correct score until I changed it to be initialized to 0.
People keep talking about op's solution, I'm new to community puzzles, how do I go about seeing op's solution? I would like to see what I was doing wrong with the combo multiplier.
All we need now is a puzzle for calculating PP ;)

Those capital O in the game's name. :(
I think you may explain concisely some game's concepts, like “beatmap” or “hit circle” at the beginning of the text. Like others said it's hard to understand with the current text.
Seriously, osu! is here too? I certainly didn't expect that...

The concept of building a score calculator is cool.
But I think there might be too many details.
Is it possible to keep the concept but simplify the methods?
Also, the solution you provided is not well readable.
You reuse stats, diffMult, and mods multiple times while you can simply define new variables.
The Indent is also not very clear since there are both 2 spaces and 4 spaces in the code.
Also, there are 7 warnings.
It will be nice if you can fix these in your solution.
It's a cool puzzle anyway.
I like your puzzle Shoko, I'll give it a go during the week
Complex and uninteresting for me who don't know what is Osu!

There is a *lot* of test cases (like my Tree puzzle) and most of the tests results are resolved with my own solution
So if anyone notice any errors between yours and what is expected, don't hesitate to tell me in the comments section

I just wanted to create a puzzle related to the Osu! universe, so I understand that can be "uninteresting" for  someone doesn't play Osu!

But I just wanted to ask why did you think it is complex ? This puzzle is more about "find the useful information" about your current task on the puzzle. The only thing is that there is a LOT of details, but that's all :/
Thanks for the comment, but can you rewrite it in English please ?

Maybe you can better introduce the Osu! universe. I don't know this game either and I have to admit that I'm already lost after the first lines of your description.
Maybe you can also simplify the problem? You don't have to follow the exact same rules as in Osu!, do you?
You could check with some players and non-players what they think of the puzzle and compare the feedback :)
Good luck!
Strangely, the puzzle has a +12 score and became "popular". But it has few comments...
